results.title: Marlon Brando
results.creator_credit: Claudio Masenza, Donatella Baglivo and Ciak Studio
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hollywood’s rebels”.
This documentary highlights the experiences of those that worked with Marlon Brando, whether cast or crew, throughout his career, and provides a unique insight into the man himself. Director Claudio Masenza has collated a myriad of interviews from colleagues, friends and family, as well as stills and film clips to give a thorough overview of Brando’s acting career, and although much praise is bestowed on the star the rebellious presence of Brando on the Hollywood stage is also discussed. Candid accounts and anecdotes make up this portrayal of Brando’s darker side in tandem with a sensitive discussion of the talent that made Brando one of the most sought after actors in Hollywood following his debut in the 1950s.

results.title: Hollow Knight
results.brief_description: Hollow Knight is an award-winning platforming game developed by Australian indie studio Team Cherry.

constellations_primary.name: Silent adventures (Hollow Knight - Education)
constellations_primary.description: Videogames, film and TV usually rely on the spoken word to communicate character and story. It wasn’t always this way. Although we may think of ‘silent films’ as in the past, there are contemporary videogames and films that shy away from using the spoken word.

results.description:
Hollow Knight is an award-winning platforming game developed by Australian indie studio Team Cherry.

Players explore vast underground catacombs of the ruined Hallownest kingdom. Much of the map is locked off to the player in the beginning but becomes accessible after the player finds key objects or gains new or enhanced skills.

Initially created through a successful Kickstarter campaign, Hollow Knight has playful animation, slick game mechanics and a unique gothic aesthetic that has seen it sell over a million copies worldwide.
description_for_label:

results.title: Australian Capital Territory
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Holiday”.
Australia’s capital city, although relatively young, offers a range of cultural, historical and natural attractions. Enjoy panoramic views of Canberra from a hot air balloon, a ride into Snowy River country, a 4WD adventure through the ACT or a coach tour to the War Memorial, the National Film and Sound Archive, Parliament House or the National Art Gallery.

results.title: South Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Holiday”.
Visit the rich, fertile Barossa Valley, trek into the outback, enjoy the spectacular view from Mt Lofty House in the Adelaide Hills beautifully restored after the 1983 Ash Wednesday bush fires, visit the Gawler Ranges and the seaside town of Victor Harbour, charter a yacht at Port Lincoln, explore the heritage buildings in the mining town of Burra, journey by train from Adelaide to Alice Springs on the legendary Ghan, stay in an underground hotel in the opal mining town of Coober Pedy and finally enjoy a boat trip at Coorong.

results.title: Queensland
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Holiday”.
Beginning with Brisbane’s elegant houses, this Queensland travel video also moves inland and along the expansive coastline. Enjoy the recreational activities on Hamilton Island, join a backpack tour that includes scuba diving, bush walking and horse riding, experience the Stockman’s Hall of Fame and the waterhole which inspired the Waltzing Matilda legend, visit the beaches of Surfer’s Paradise and Noosa, kayak in the Daintree Forest or sail to tranquil locations in the Whitsuday Islands.

results.title: Holiday
results.brief_description: From ABC Television’s award-winning and popularly acclaimed travel program ‘Holiday’ comes a series of eight fabulous videos covering every facet of holidaying in the states and territories of Australia. Whether you’re looking for a luxury five star resort or the chance to get off the beaten track, this series has got Australia covered.

results.title: Tasmania
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Holiday”.
Tasmania’s attractions highlighted in this video range from the picturesque landscapes of Cataract Gorge, Cradle Mountain and Flinders Island to relaxing sporting events such as fishing at London Lakes and viewing the Targa Road Race. Visit historical Port Arthur, Hawley House and the grave of Tom Roberts and indulge in a novelty stop-over at a reproduction Swiss Village.

results.title: New South Wales
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Holiday”.
Enjoy the tranquil beauty of Myall Lakes, experience a journey on the Zig Zag railway aboard a steam locomotion, tour Fort Denison or take an alpine escape to the Snowy Mountains, view the spectacular rugged coastline at Murramarang, cruise Sydney Harbour on a replica of the ‘Bounty’, stargaze in the Warrumbungles, visit the Blue Mountains, sample the local product at the Pepper Tree vineyard in the Hunter Valley - the cradle of Australian wine making and complete your New South Wales tour with a 9 day marathon bike road tour.

results.title: Victoria
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Holiday”.
Rich in history and culture, Victoria also boasts a fine selection of food and spectacular natural landscapes. Melbourne’s main attractions open the program including trams, tree-lined boulevards, splendid buildings and magnificent gardens. Its country and coastal regions offer visitors a diverse range of activities from horse riding in the Great Dividing Ranges, experiencing the gold rush at Sovereign Hill, ‘cruising’ Lake Eildon, visiting Flagstaff Hill Maritime Museum, relaxing at Daylesford and Hepburn Springs, rock-climbing at Mount Arapiles and for the gourmet traveller a residential cooking school at Howqua Dale.
